properties.description: U.S. federal law aimed at improving corporate transparency and accountability, including provisions for cybersecurity and IT controls.

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Source
metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.

metadata.displayName: Warn
metadata.description: Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

metadata.displayName: Allowed capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a container. Provide empty list as input to block everything.

metadata.displayName: Required drop capabilities
metadata.description: The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a container.

metadata.displayName: Containers exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identify is the name of container. Use an empty list to apply this policy to all containers in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Image exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)
metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos
metadata.description: Specifies the encryption types that Kerberos is allowed to use.

metadata.displayName: Network security: LAN Manager authentication level
metadata.description: Specify which challenge-response authentication protocol is used for network logons. This choice affects the level of authentication protocol used by clients, the level of session security negotiated, and the level of authentication accepted by servers.

metadata.displayName: Network security: LDAP client signing requirements
metadata.description: Specify the level of data signing that is requested on behalf of clients that issue LDAP BIND requests.

metadata.displayName: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by clients for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/network-security-minimum-session-security-for-ntlm-ssp-based-including-secure-rpc-servers for more information.

metadata.displayName: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by servers for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services.

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations (Microsoft.ClassicNetwork/networkSecurityGroups/securityRules/write)

metadata.displayName: Members to exclude
metadata.description: A semicolon-separated list of members that should be excluded in the Administrators local group. Ex: Administrator; myUser1; myUser2

metadata.displayName: Source
metadata.description: The source k8s object for constraint evaluation. 'Original' means only evaluate against the specific GroupVersionKind specified in the policy definition. 'Generated' means only evaluate against k8s objects generated by Gatekeeper ExpansionTemplates. 'All' means evaluate against both the original object and any generated ones.

metadata.displayName: Warn
metadata.description: Whether or not to return warnings back to the user in the kubectl cli

metadata.description: For more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Image exclusions
metadata.description: The list of InitContainers and Containers to exclude from policy evaluation. The identifier is the image of container. Prefix-matching can be signified with `*`. For example: `myregistry.azurecr.io/istio:*`. It is recommended that users use the fully-qualified Docker image name (e.g. start with a domain name) in order to avoid unexpectedly exempting images from an untrusted repository.

metadata.displayName: Namespace exclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to exclude from policy evaluation. System namespaces "kube-system", "gatekeeper-system" and "azure-arc" are always excluded by design. "azure-extensions-usage-system" is optional to remove.

metadata.displayName: Namespace inclusions
metadata.description: List of Kubernetes namespaces to only include in policy evaluation. An empty list means the policy is applied to all resources in all namespaces.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources for policy evaluation. An empty label selector matches all Kubernetes resources.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Admin Approval Mode for the Built-in Administrator account
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of Admin Approval Mode for the built-in Administrator account.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of the elevation prompt for administrators.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Detect application installations and prompt for elevation
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of application installation detection for the computer.

metadata.displayName: UAC: Run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode
metadata.description: Specifies the behavior of all User Account Control (UAC) policy settings for the computer.

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers
metadata.description: By selecting this option, you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine.

metadata.displayName: Enforce password history
metadata.description: Specifies limits on password reuse - how many times a new password must be created for a user account before the password can be repeated.

metadata.displayName: Maximum password age
metadata.description: Specifies the maximum number of days that may elapse before a user account password must be changed. The format of the value is two integers separated by a comma, denoting an inclusive range.

metadata.displayName: Minimum password age
metadata.description: Specifies the minimum number of days that must elapse before a user account password can be changed.

metadata.displayName: Minimum password length
metadata.description: Specifies the minimum number of characters that a user account password may contain.

metadata.displayName: Password must meet complexity requirements
metadata.description: Specifies whether a user account password must be complex. If required, a complex password must not contain part of  user's account name or full name; be at least 6 characters long; contain a mix of uppercase, lowercase, number, and non-alphabetic characters.

metadata.displayName: Include Arc connected servers

metadata.displayName: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Remotely accessible registry paths and sub-paths
metadata.description: Specifies which registry paths and sub-paths will be accessible over the network, regardless of the users or groups listed in the access control list (ACL) of the `winreg` registry key.

metadata.displayName: Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously
metadata.description: Specifies which network shares can be accessed by anonymous users. The default configuration for this policy setting has little effect because all users have to be authenticated before they can access shared resources on the server.
